metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5150 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebKit/Source/bindings/modules/v8/V8BindingForModules.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 53.0.2785.89 on Windows and OS X and before 53.0.2785.92 on Linux, has an Indexed Database (aka IndexedDB) API implementation that does not properly restrict key-path evaluation, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code that leverages certain side effects.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1254').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.7-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
